stem: Given question: He enjoyed the factory work, he liked the idea that he did what for sale? and answer: produce goods, explain why in
no_more_50_words: Factory work involves producing goods, and him liking the factory work indicates he might like producing goods.
100_to_150_words: He enjoyed the factory work because he liked the idea that he was producing goods for sale. The factory environment provided a sense of purpose and accomplishment in his life, as he was able to make tangible products that would eventually be bought by customers. He felt pride in the quality of his workmanship, and enjoyed the satisfaction of being able to create something that people would want to buy. The pay was also a bonus, giving him an extra incentive to work hard and make sure that he was producing the best quality goods. All of these factors made the factory work an enjoyable experience for him, and he found that it gave him a sense of satisfaction that he hadn't felt in other jobs.
